java/liquibase/util/NetUtil.java

00001 package liquibase.util;
00002 
00003 import java.net.InetAddress;
00004 import java.net.UnknownHostException;
00005 import java.net.SocketException;
00006 import java.net.NetworkInterface;
00007 import java.util.Enumeration;
00008 
00009 public class NetUtil {
00010 
00014     public static InetAddress getLocalHost() throws UnknownHostException, SocketException {
00015         // Windows Vista returns the IPv6 InetAddress using this method, which is not
00016         // particularly useful as it has no name or useful address, just "0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1".
00017         // That is why windows should be treated differently to linux/unix and use the
00018         // default way of getting the localhost.
00019         String osName = System.getProperty("os.name");
00020         if (osName != null && osName.toLowerCase().contains("windows")) {
00021             return InetAddress.getLocalHost();
00022         }
00023       
00024         InetAddress lch = null;
00025         Enumeration<NetworkInterface> e = NetworkInterface.getNetworkInterfaces();
00026 
00027         while (e.hasMoreElements()) {
00028             NetworkInterface i = e.nextElement();
00029 
00030             Enumeration<InetAddress> ie = i.getInetAddresses();
00031             if (!ie.hasMoreElements()) {
00032                 break;
00033             }
00034             lch = ie.nextElement();
00035             if (!lch.isLoopbackAddress()) break;
00036         }
00037         return lch;
00038     }
00039 
00040 }
